availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Walter R. Franklin (Frankfort, Kentucky, court clerk)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Married Agnes L. Brawner Franklin on July 27, 1854. Father of Mary C. Franklin, Philip S. Franklin, Robert B. Franklin, and Walter M. Franklin. Clerk in Frankfort in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Clerk of Franklin Circuit Court from 1862 to 1866.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 106; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 98; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 15; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 32; Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Kentucky, Franklin County Marriages, July 27, 1854, p. 1; Find A Grave, "Walter R. Franklin (1823-1899)," Memorial #59090826, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=59090826&ref=acom (accessed March 27, 2017).
